page.title: 12THE DERELICT LAND
page.content: The area we are studying near to our school is mostly wasteland. There used to be a housing estate there but there are only 6 houses left standing, three boarded up and three bought. The houses had been there for about twelve years. They were pulled down because they had been built on marsh land which had not been drained well enough and the damp rose up into the houses. Also, they were purpose built in bolted sections with flat roofs. When it rained the water stayed on the roofs and gradually the water soaked into the houses and made them damp. There used to be four streets there and they were called Cheviot Place, Pennine Walk, Cleveland Place and Cumbrian Place. There used to be a shop but it has closed down because there's no one left to buy things. It's now a Community Task Force Centre
